review_title: Progression at UM is nearly impossible
pros:
Many of the top, top level (VC) positions actually care, but once an issue hits their desk, it is dire and only one case. 
Job security
Decent benefits, but not great
Largest employer in Oxford
Easier to move to another department once you've landed your first position
cons:
It is rare a department will promote you in the same department or do a JAQ to increase your salary and title. They like going with fresh blood over loyal, trained employees.

Raises aren't really a thing, neither is negotiating your salary. 

Be prepared for exhausting red tape, internal conflicts and gossip, and a general disgruntled-ness that the administration pretends doesn't exist but does.

job_title: Computer Support Specialist in University, MS
pros:
-Incredibly easy to work for
-Management is very aware that life happens outside of work.  They are always ready and willing to work with most situations.  They are incredibly welcoming and warm.
-They do a good job of taking care of their employees.  Any and all questions are answered and never looked down upon.
cons:
-Unless you are in the football department, you are essentially tossed aside and not considered important.  This is the first position in a University that I have ever held, and I am appalled at how much focus that put on the football team.  The assistant coach receives $3 million/year, but we haven't had a raise in over 5 years.
-The pay ceiling is very low.  And it seems to be incredibly difficult to move up into a better position.

pros: Education is accessible for all here.  It's the Harvard of the South.
cons:
Since it's a small city, people are not as segregated as in a larger city.  This makes the locals and the new folks suspicious of others.  I often see newbies arrive with a smile, but later they are paranoid.  It's unfortunate.

If you're a person of color or a Jew, be patient and reserved.  The city police, not campus police, stop me from time to time.  Usually they ask where am I going.  This is when I go for walks.  I've learned to walk now where they won't notice me as much, or where there are a lot of people.  I was afraid at first because of the posturing, speaking over me, standing very closely.  Now I'm indifferent.  Fortunately, I'm an adult.  If I was a teenager, I might not have the patience and speak back.  In Louisiana, I've never been harassed.  Just be careful.

Don't expect any politeness.  Just do your work and you'll be fine.  Good luck!

pros: Ole Miss has a progressive and supportive administration and the leadership across the university is outstanding. Our campus has been ranked as the most beautiful in America. The arts are excellent and athletic teams are fun to watch. Oxford is an amazing place to live. Overall, it's a great place to work.
cons: Faculty and staff salaries are low in many areas of the university. The administration has made this a priority with consistent raises over the past three years. The closest airport for the most convenient travel is Memphis which is about 70 minutes away but because it is small it is easy to navigate quickly.

review_title: Front Desk Assistant / Community Desk Assistant
job_title: Community Desk Assistant in Oxford, MS
pros: Great if you want a job on campus and to meet new people
cons:
You do not get paid enough for the job you do. The base pay is $7.40 and the overnight pay is only $8.00

You may be put into situations where your coworkers will not show up to work putting you in a tough spot because you cannot leave the desk without someone present. 

Accountability for actions is also not very popular with the university period.

review_title: Not Marketing, It's Customer Service! Avoid!!!
job_title: Marketing Assistant, Student Housing in Oxford, MS
pros: Branded Polo, Interact with prospective student/parents
cons: Company culture was the worst I have ever experienced. Older student workers were condescending to newer employees. Management had no idea the toxic environment lower management had created over the team. They did not train new student employees, had to learn on the go. During interview for job, was told that it would be marketing related duties. It was actually sales/customer service. You're mainly sitting around answering phone calls from irate parents, (that totally have a right to be b/c of outdated and incompetent policies against students), and giving tours to prospective students without any training other than told to memorize a script that doesn't even make sense.

pros: As a student-employee, the flexibility of working on campus was a big selling point. I got a lot of classwork done in short intervals between my shifts and class time.
cons: The beaurocracy of the university can be exhausting at times. From my experience, payroll especially is not willing to be flexible at all about paperwork and deadlines. Make sure you submit all relevant information to the right people and on time.

pros: It can be every students dream to work on campus, especially as a Research Assistant. They pay your tuition fee while you are gaining experiences. It is the best job in the world.
cons: Working on campus as an RA means you have to work really hard, especially when you get a pushing boss, a qualification exam within 2 months and 3 courses to take.

pros: The University is a non-discriminatory public institution with decent pay and multiples levels and options for employment. I was able to balance working and going to class with outside obligations. Pay was made directly to me on a bi-weekly basis. There was opportunity to work during school breaks.
cons: Sometimes my job was not essential, so I ended up doing things that I didn't feel was super important - but most of the time I felt like I was helping the University and they were helping me.

review_title: Pre-College Program Counselor has a lot of perks, but is time-consuming
job_title: Summer College for High School Counselor in University, MS
pros: Other counselors were awesome and fun to be around, and you also get to be an ambassador to Ole Miss to high achieving high school students.
cons: Although it's a lot of fun and the pros vastly outweigh the cons, it's a little time-consuming and unorganized. There are also too many high school students to get to know all of them.

pros:
- Caring staff and faculty
- Somewhat diverse student population (an important mix of historically privileged and under-privileged students)
- Attention to improving campus culture and great potential for more positive change
cons:
- Salaries determined by state government that doesn't value education enough
- Tension of a changing but still mainly conservative campus culture
- Large state school with traditional party culture and large Greek life culture

review_title: Great Place To Work, But Be Aware
pros: Many job opportunities on campus for undergrads. Beautiful campus. Great place to network.
cons: Oxford is super small and it can be a pain to get around sometimes. Parking is terrible. School not focused enough on diversity and inclusion. Hate groups occasionally pop up.

pros: The University of Mississippi is located in Oxford, a beautiful, quaint town. The University itself is also beautiful and diverse, and has been doing a lot of work over the past few years to lead the state out of the dark ages.
cons: It's in Mississippi, and sporting events kind of take over the whole town at times. It's definitely a small town setting, which means that sometimes there isn't much else going on.

pros:
Staff tutition wavier
Great co-workers and colleages
Very interesting R&D work and topics.
Exposure to multiple topics
Always in an environment of applying science and engineering to real life application
cons:
Some travel envolved
Combination of heat and humidity (yeah, I'm a sissy)
That's the way we've always done it
You're in Mississippi now son, ha.

review_title: A good workplace for both graduates and undergraduaes
pros: Friendly atmosphere, easy going professors, equipped with all most all instruments. small size classes so that easy to get contact with professors whenever we have a question. Scenic campus
cons: Small department, Not much grant money in the department. So most of the times students have to teach almost every semester until they graduate. So very less chances of getting research assistance ship until you wait till end of your graduation.

pros: Can't beat the tuition waiver (especially if you're out of state) and stiffen.  Awesome healthcare benefits for grad assistants.
cons: I wish there were more 20 hr/week assistantships available.  Although the specifics of each job is contingent on the department, it seems fairly difficult to find a full-time assistantship.

pros: You can work as a student and it is a very relaxed environment where many ideas are shared. You learn life skills and make nice friends.
cons: They don't pay hardly anything and they hours are few and bad. The equipment was antiquated and worked poorly. Student workers are not thoroughly trained and FCC guidelines are not observed normally.

pros: I got to meet many people and participate in many different programs. I also got experience in managing many different types of issues.
cons: It was frustrating how disorganized everything was. I never knew what to expect. I also was forced to cover desk shifts that I shouldn't have since they weren't competent enough to hire someone for these shifts after 3 weeks.

pros: Ole Miss has one of the most beautiful campuses in the United States and that beauty resonated in the workplace. Everyone tries to work together towards a common goal. Aside from the occasional upset parent, you'll love coming to work.
cons: There was some favortism in different departments. Also, like any job, there were people who did not know what they were doing.

review_title: Great job, great people, redundant work
job_title: Computer Support Specialist in University, MS
pros: Great coworkers, positive work environment, great learning environment. It's one of the most laid-back jobs I've had, but you still have to work. Everyone does their fair share here,
cons: Job gets redundant, speaking to computer-illiterate people is a pain, and golf carts are run down.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Tupelo, MS
pros: Enjoyed working with students and hearing the various backgrounds that each individual came from. The Writing Center Director was my favorite writing professor as well, and she was so creative in how to work with students. Fun and relaxed environment that encouraged personal growth and learning as well.
cons: Wished I could have continued working there after I graduated. I enjoyed it. No cons.

review_title: Great Way for Student to Make Extra Money
job_title: Student Employee In Technological Services Department in University, MS
pros: I worked in Baxter Hall with the guys who fix all the computer hardware on campus. They were excellent. Earnie was very flexible with my hours, and I learned a lot working for them.
cons: The pay is kind of low and your hours are limited by the amount of course hours in which you are enrolled.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Oxford, MS
pros: You get between 4-6 weeks paid time off every year depending on your adviser.  The sciences (or at least biology) offers the highest stipend in the SEC (aside from Vanderbilt).
cons: Parking is horrendous.  The university prioritizes sports above all else so it's nearly impossible to get work done on home game weekends, especially during football season.

review_title: Great place to work as a student
job_title: Student Writing Center Tutor in Southaven, MS
pros:
Hour flexibility- you pick your hours and work as much as you want up to 25 per week 
The writing center director is amazing and always there to help
cons: Pay is pretty low. $9-11 per hour. But that is any student job

pros: Friendly collaborative atmosphere mostly and resources to get done what needs to get done.
cons: Horrible regulations regarding sick time--truly breeds a culture of distrust. Human Resources assumes that you will abuse sick days by the construction of its policy.

pros: I was a Community Assistant for student housing. They treated us very well, paid us the best in Mississippi, and had a lot of fun community and staff building activities that made working for them fun.
cons: It was hard living and working in the same building, I didn't have a great work/life balance.

job_title: Assistant Professor (Visiting In A College of Liberal Arts Department ) in Oxford, MS
pros: Colleagues are collegial and the campus is beautiful.
cons: Too many adjuncts, not enough diversity in administration, poor performing students, and low pay.

review_title: Community Assistant / Resource Specialist for Student Housing
job_title: Community Assistant/Resource Specialist in Oxford, MS
pros: Decent enough pay, on-campus job, looks good on a resume, meet some great people (many of whom became friends for life)
cons: Poor communication, low hiring standards, a lack of respect between workers on every level

review_title: Great place for students to get part-time work
pros: I was a student working part-time, and they were very accommodating with student's work schedules.
cons: The only con I would complain about is the pay.  It would be nice to make more than minimum wage, but it's understandable.

review_title: Comfortable work demands, not much pay
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Oxford, MS
pros: Lots of flexibility, some really great professors to work with
cons:
Lots of racial tensions on campus. Not by the employer of course, but in the larger community. 
Not much pay.
Not much supervision.

pros: Exceptional leadership work experience, coupled with a great compensation package.
cons: Personally, I find the work very intrusive when it comes to the collection of information on student's daily lives; there should be some ethical and privacy concerns about data collection on students by community assistants.

review_title: Overall a good company to work for
pros: Diversity among departments. Human Resources provides various courses on social development. Technology center offers courses on Microsoft Suite and others. Great place to launch career in research/healthcare
cons: Employee parking is a pain. Salary could be better for people with Bachelor’s degrees.

pros:
Nice People
Good Benefits
Parties were a blast! I chugged 7 kegs one night hahaha
Work with people.
cons:
Weather
Small(ish) town
Company issued computers broke sometimes.
Thats it, not many cons ay?

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Oxford, MS
pros: Provided a decent stipend for graduate students
cons: Professors often seemed out of touch with how much work is required to teach a lab twice a week in addition to maintaining 3.0 GPA and taking own classes as they still expected 40 hours of research

pros: Can be a great and fun, fast paced, energetic work environment
cons: Sometimes employees bring their outside issues into the workplace, creating an unhealthy work environment for other employees.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse  in Jackson, MS
pros: At University Of Mississippi (Jackson Campus), you are treated as a person. Everyone is apart of the team.
cons: High Insurance Rate after retirement

job_title: Campus Recreation Supervisor in Benton, KY
pros: You have a great flexible schedule that allows you time for classes or if you have another job
cons: The pay is minimum wage which can be a downfall but being able to choose your own schedule outweighs the cons.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Dillon, SC
pros: Independent thinking, Analytical skills, excellent atmosphere
cons: limited in collaboration an funds to disperse to graduate students, should have minimum stipends on fixed scale for doctoral students

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Oxford, MS
pros: Nice small town, Not too far from Memphis,  The Grove is awesome during the football weekends, Has all the facilities to conduct world class research.
cons: The town could be too quite sometimes

pros: Manager is very easy to talk to, flexible with scheduling around classes, fun atmosphere. Great part time job during college
cons: Cap on hours that can be worked during school semesters, pay is regulated

job_title: Computer Science Lab Teaching Assistant & Orientation Leader in Dillon, SC
pros: Good Experience. Flexible hours. Great faculty.
cons: Students want to be spoon-fed at times.

job_title: Student Computer Technician in Dillon, SC
pros:
- Easy job with no stress and maximum flexibility.
-You are allowed to do homework and study while working.
cons: - Pay is minimal, but that is usually how it is with part time student jobs.

pros: The staff was great to work with, not only in my dept. but all over the hospital.
cons: One of the downsides of working at UMC was the rooms were outdated.

review_title: This was a great learning experience for undergraduates.
pros: Flexible hours, great learning tools to clerical work
cons: Customers are not always very friendly, and this can make the job stressful.

review_title: The Ugly Side of Ole Miss
job_title: Parking Enforcement Officer in Dillon, SC
pros:
* Beautiful campus 
* Healthy work-life balance
cons:
* Racism and hate runs deep--students, faculty, and staff all contribute
* The insular networks and good ole boy system makes it hard to advance

pros: Great people and great learning environment
cons: some racial and stereotype students still attend the university but aren't as offensive as they used to be in the university's past

pros: Easier money, does not take up a lot of time and most importantly, you learn a subject so much better when you teach it!
cons: Grading was tedious but really wasn't terrible

job_title: Student Traffic Appeals Board in Oxford, MS
pros: Amazing pay for the job! I really learned conflict resolution skills and the ins and outs of the parking system
cons: Dealing with angry students, but we had great support from management

pros: I love being an Ole Miss student. The opportunities provided to us are amazing, and the educational experience that I receive is state of the art.
cons: I cannot think of any cons.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Oxford, MS
pros:
- Great pay for graduate research assistants
- Allows you to work and attend classes at the same time
- HR office is excellent to work with
cons: None, I loved this job!

pros: Oxford is a beautiful place and the students are nice
cons: They will never give you a raise, and your benefits will decline from the first day you get there.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in University, MS
pros: Beautiful Campus, great department and friendly people.
cons: Far south, so not many industrial opportunities near University. Has to relocate to either east coast or  west coast for a job.

pros:
Get free room to occupy
Insurance provided to reduce the price needed to pay for the mandatory insurance plan
Reduced price meal plan
cons: Have to cover the front desk late night

pros: Positive and welcoming work environment, flexible hours and exceptional pay for a student.
cons: Student parking is awful! UPD is the worst.

pros: Great benefits, retirement, and tuition waiver for courses.
cons: Politics can be annoying and preventative to promotions.

review_title: There are some amazing folks at this university.
pros: Great campus, people and great town.
cons: I worked for an Institute that had zero oversight by the administration.

pros:
Work at own pace
Family Friendly
Great professor
cons:
Low salary
More emphasis given to other programs (in psychology department) 
Not a lot of guidance on how to file paperwork

pros:
- Good work atmosphere
- Good pay
cons: UM is a great place to study and work. They provide good benefits too so no cons at all.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Oxford, MS
pros: Support for family/work balance, research opportunities, and collegiality. Values diversity and inclusion.
cons: Housing costs are exorbitant and not in line with below average compensation

review_title: Peaceful town and school with less exposure

pros: stability, easy to move on, opportunity to grow, research, team

job_title: Social Media Manager in Oxford, MS
pros: Great place for student worker positions. Fun co-workers and great boss. Loved everyone in the office and loved working there!

pros: Ole Miss supports its staff members,
cons: I do not have a Con to working at Ole Miss.

review_title: Good place to work, everyone in the department is nice and willing to help.
pros: Nice academic environment, good teaching and research experience

pros: Great administration, excellent work environment, beautiful campus, Honors College

pros: good people, low cost of living, mixed cultures,

pros: Great place to work.

review_title: Great Place to Work While in School
job_title: Writing Center Consultant in Oxford, MS

job_title: IT Student Worker in Oxford, MS

job_title: Modern Languages Assistant in Oxford, MS
